headline: Nvidia Plans to Invest Up to $100 Billion in OpenAI. It May Be Why Broadcom Stock Is Falling.
summary: The partnership will deploy at least 10 gigawatts of Nvidia AI systems to train and run OpenAI’s next-generation AI models.

raw.headline: Nvidia Plans to Invest Up to $100 Billion in OpenAI. It May Be Why Broadcom Stock Is Falling.

headline: A Deal Between AI Powers Lifts Stock Market to a Record
summary: The stock market notched new records Monday thanks to a blockbuster deal between two of the largest players in the artificial-intelligence boom.  Nvidia  shares advanced 3.9%—reaching their own all-time high—after the chip maker said it would invest up to $100 billion in ChatGPT maker OpenAI to fund an enormous data-center build-out.

raw.headline: A Deal Between AI Powers Lifts Stock Market to a Record

headline: U.S. Stocks Rise to Records as Nvidia, OpenAI Link Up
summary: U.S. stocks ended higher after Nvidia said it would invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI to help build out the ChatGPT maker’s data centers.

raw.headline: U.S. Stocks Rise to Records as Nvidia, OpenAI Link Up
raw.summary: U.S. stocks ended higher after Nvidia said it would invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI to help build out the ChatGPT maker’s data centers.

headline: Nvidia-OpenAI Deal Hits Broadcom Stock
summary: Monday's blockbuster AI deal between Nvidia and OpenAi hit Broadcom shares. The announcement landed at noon ET, sending Nvidia shares up 3.9% and turning a modest Broadcom rally into a 1.6% loss on the day.

headline: As the VMware vSphere 7 Support Deadline Nears, Spinnaker Announces Alternative Option to Keep VMware Customers Supported Indefinitely
summary: DENVER, September 22, 2025--Spinnaker Support (Spinnaker), the Oracle, SAP and VMware software support specialist trusted by over 1,000 global clients, including many of the world’s leading banks, telcos and utility companies, announces today that it will provide support for organizations running vSphere 7 indefinitely - meaning organizations running vSphere 7 for as long as they want past Broadcom’s End of General Support Deadline (EoGS) of October 2, 2025.
